channel.title: The purpose of life?
channel.description: What is the point of life? No matter what you do, it will be surpassed by somebody in the future, and you will be forgotten. If you make no difference, what's the point? I have my own answer, but I'm interested in other people's responses.

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:52, topic:429712”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=532392.msg3893085#msg3893085 date=1327074389]
The purpose of life is to die, it all happens to us sooner or later.
[/quote]
Not for me, I’m going to steal peoples organs when mine are failing.[/quote]Awesome idea.

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:42, topic:429712”][quote author=ytuio9` link=topic=532392.msg3892293#msg3892293 date=1326982182]

Show me proof. How could Living creatures Come from non-life in the beginning? How could nothing create everything?

That’s not evolution.
[/quote]
You have to believe that nothing created everything by default. The big bang happened from nothing as far as we know it just happened for no reason, there were no laws of physics before the big bang.[/quote]No you don’t. The big bang theory doesn’t even attempt to answer what came before it, how the ‘spinning dot’ came into existence, or the state of the universe before the big bang.

Also, the same assumption must be made about creationism… How did whatever god get there? If you claim he was always there, then why can’t the ‘spinning dot’ always have been there?

BTW I say ‘spinning dot’ because most people don’t even have an idea what singularity is, or the conceptual faculties required to imaging something so hot and dense.

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9`, post:41, topic:429712”][quote author=lostmyphat link=topic=532392.msg3891643#msg3891643 date=1326921827]
Show me proof. How could Living creatures Come from non-life in the beginning? How could nothing create everything?
[/quote]
That’s not evolution.[/quote]
You have to believe that nothing created everything by default. The big bang happened from nothing as far as we know it just happened for no reason, there were no laws of physics before the big bang.

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

Cole1497:

Just getting my two cents in before the lock, it’s not proven 100% that evolution is true, that’s why it’s still a theory.

but there is enough evidence to logically decide for yourself. for instance, christians argue that the world is not but 4000-6000 years old…well, there is radiocarbon dating, and radiometric dating provides even more history than that does; and the big bang was not a random explosion–it was probably a huge supernova that wiped out previous existence. there’s no telling atm. arguments like this are pointless. i just don’t understand how people can just go by a book rather than finding out for themselves–a bit ignorant if you ask me.

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“frozon566, post:32, topic:429712”]Well if you say evolution is false then people have nothing else besides “God” so they cry its 100% proven.
And I’m not intending this to be a “my God could beat up your God” thread It’s just theres enough data against and for all beliefs that its retarded to think we can 100% know.
Also I knew it would only be a matter of time before this thread blew up into a evolution vs religion thread so I’m going to stop posting on this thread.[/quote]That’s not even remotely true. I’m very content with not knowing the answer to ‘important’ questions. There are not two schools of thought, there are many, and each is an alternative; some have merit and others do not.

It’s not evolution vs religion. (Micro) evolution is already accepted by several religions organizations. So, it’s already won.

Also, evolution doesn’t even have anything to do with this thread… It is, simply put, the process of things changing over time; that being said, how does that explain the purpose of life?

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

There is no purpose but I don’t believe in evolution or a greater being until proven.
At the moment my current theory is that we’ve come from aliens (seriously).

EDIT; From reading posts above let me rephrase this, - I don’t believe that we evolved from apes or any other species on this planet.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“lostmyphat, post:29, topic:429712”]That’s bs. If evolution was proven to be 100% true, then it would be known. It is quite obvious there are many flaws In your arguement.[/quote]It is know… Just because you don’t know it doesn’t make it unknown, or incorrect. Do about 10 minutes of research. Also, Many religion organizations even recognize it, which requires an extreme amount of proof.

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

There is no real point to it. We were created, but we’re nothing special. We are just a machine in a way, and we only are able to live because that’s the way we function. Many people think that humans are the gods or master of the universe, when in reality, we’re made of the same things as everything else. We just got lucky and were given this ability to live.

Read full topic

item.title: The purpose of life?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

lostmyphat:

That’s bs. If evolution was proven to be 100% true, then it would be known. It is quite obvious there are many flaws In your arguement.

Evolution is 100% correct, your living right now, aren’t you?
We’re located in the perfect spot in space so we can live, our sun isn’t a blue dwarf and its not a giant thing. Life could have came from some organism traveling on a meteor, or maybe the sun and the earth’s atmosphere created life, who the fuck knows. We evolved from a common ancestor, and nobody knows exactly what it is.

Read full topic
